description: Cusick’s camass (Camassia cusickii) is an amazing species of flowering plant native to the northwestern United States. It blooms with attractive lavender-blue flowers that continue for several weeks throughout the summer months. It is incredibly easy to grow and can be propagated from both seed as well as by division. The attractive foliage provides an important food source for a variety of birds and animals, while the flowers attract butterflies, bees, and other beneficial insects. Its drought and heat-tolerant form ensures that it will thrive in most gardens with minimal care. Cusick’s camass makes a wonderful addition to any garden and is sure to bring tons of color and life.
